Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @Nick Bk (YAF.fy) the actual Komodo notaries can't do this. Komodo has no other fungible chains. @blackjok3r is talking about the notaries for #kmdlabs which is a testing environment for new features and chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: MoMoM has been enabled on KMD notaries, there is just no chains that use it yet

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Well ... thats not exactly right .. the MoMoM deos not mean the chains a re fungible .. but it does enable cross chain contracts.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: any chains with ccid > 1 (so 2 to 100) are using it already.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But they do not support migrate/import/export transactions.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
@Nick Bk (YAF.fy)  this post might explain migrations for you - http://rant.cryptocartography.io/tokens-without-borders-migration/

It is basically a way to allow chains within the same cluster to be fungible. It only works if you have the migrations CC contract enabled on your asset chains, and the source/destination chain has the same ccid (i.e. are on the same cluster of chains).

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: 5% comes from UTXO existing.  Just the existence of having a UTXO with >10 KMD entitles it to 5% per year after approx 1 hour.    The UTXO when spent then claims this reward, it's part of the blockchain rules (consensus) which every node can see and verify.
